Articles.Content: What mods do you guys recommend for a kerbalism career playthough i was wanting to play with as stock as possible maybe with restock+. Wanted to know if there are any mods i should get like i heard of scansat. I also wanted to start off with probes and have better contracts and administration mod that makes them better too. Is it possible to visit every planet on outer planets mod with kerbalism stock parts?

My recommendation is the Simplex suite of mods... with ReStock, ReStockPlus,  Kerbalism Simplex and Simplex Resources to have a stockish feel to ISRU, also Simplex Station Parts.  Use either Simplex TechTree or Quartix TechTree.  Simplex Propulsion is also good as it will add a strong end game Ion Engine to het you to the final locations.

ScanSat is recommended with this as well...

Breaking Ground with the prop engines is totally up to you with Quartix TT.

If the focus is on visiting every planet and not having to grind funds, try AngleCan Progression.  It gives a feel of Science mode but having to upgrade facilites and buy kerbals (and only pay for fuel!) The only contracts are the world firsts.

Also Progression Plus to see what you have achieved in the Tech Tree.

On 6/14/2023 at 12:44 PM, George101 said:

What mods do you guys recommend for a kerbalism career playthough i was wanting to play with as stock as possible maybe with restock+. Wanted to know if there are any mods i should get like i heard of scansat. I also wanted to start off with probes and have better contracts and administration mod that makes them better too. Is it possible to visit every planet on outer planets mod with kerbalism stock parts?

Kerbalism doesn't really require anything else, so it's really up to you and what you want to do. 

I've always been a fan of Scansat and it works good with Kerbalism. I also quite like Nertea's series of mods, like Near Future Spacecraft, or Stockalike Station Expansion. 
Long felt that Kerbal Construction Time is mandatory for any playthrough that has life support. Basically makes time a resource to manage as well.
